title.native: 名探偵コナン 紺碧の棺 （ジョリー・ロジャー）
title.romaji: Meitantei Conan: Konpeki no Hitsugi (Jolly Roger)
title.english: Case Closed: Jolly Roger in the Deep Azure

description:
The Isle of Koumi, a beautiful island in the Pacific Ocean. On the island, people pass an old legend down from generation to generation that there was the Seabed Palace, an ancient ruin at the bottom of the sea, where the treasure of 2 female pirates, Anne Bonnie & Mary Reed (who really existed 300 years ago), was left. When Conan and his friends visit Koumi Island while on vacation, they meet some treasure hunters. There was something suspicious about them.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Meitantei Conan Movie 11: Konpeki no Hitsugi (Jolly Roger)

title.native: 名探偵コナン

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ogura_koubou)

In 1977, Ogura joined *Kobayashi Production* and learned the ropes of art direction under [Shichirou Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/103964/Shichirou-Kobayashi). In 1983 he left and established Studio Fuga together with Kouji Oono and [Toshiharu Mizutani](https://anilist.co/staff/121908/Toshiharu-Mizutani). There he eventually left as well and formed his own 'Ogura Kobo' at Production I.G., where he trains newer art directors. He continues to be a major presence at Production I.G. as one of their most prominent art directors.

Ogura's style is, similar to Kobayashi's, rooted in imposing architecture, ambient colors, and Western perspectives versus traditional Japanese isometric perspectives. Ogura's backgrounds are usually urban in setting and has a less saturated color palette, and uses more cool than warm colors. Ogura's fantastical, European Kobayashi influence is easily seen in [Wings of Honneamise](https://anilist.co/anime/1034/Ouritsu-Uchuugun-Honneamise-no-Tsubasa/), and his later work has remained distinctly metropolitan, something that can be seen even in the rural [FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/影山楙倫)

Originating from Ashi Productions.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
Yamamoto Yasuichirou is a director. He is best known as the current director of the Meitantei Conan franchise.
**Tomoko Fukunaga** is a Japanese animator and animation director.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/須藤昌朋)

Originating from Studio Annapuru, currently freelance.

Debuted as an in-betweener on the second season of [Ashita no Joe](https://anilist.co/anime/2921/). He is particularly known for his involvement in [TMS Entertainment's](https://anilist.co/studio/73/) works, mainly the [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/) franchise, in which he has served as a character designer and animation director on all of the theatrical movies.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suwacchi)

Michihiko is a producer, planner and supervisor. He is a chief producer at Yomiuri Telecasting Corporation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suwacchi)

Michihiko is a producer, planner and supervisor. He is a chief producer at Yomiuri Telecasting Corporation.
